best-apple-wallet-alternatives.p1: You're at the Italian border. The officer asks for your residence permit. You open Apple Wallet, scroll past your credit cards and last month's boarding pass, and realize: your permesso di soggiorno isn't there. It never was. Apple Wallet doesn't store identity documents. It doesn't store insurance cards, vaccination records, or visa PDFs. It stores exactly what Apple has decided counts as a "pass," and your critical documents don't make the list.
best-apple-wallet-alternatives.p2: This is the gap between expectation and reality. Apple Wallet handles tap-to-pay beautifully. It syncs boarding passes automatically. But the moment you need something that isn't a payment card or a .pkpass file from a participating provider, you're searching through Photos, Files, or your email. The passes you do have appear scattered by date added rather than organized into trips. You can't share a hotel confirmation with your partner. You can't set a reminder for when your passport expires.
best-apple-wallet-alternatives.p3: The solution isn't to abandon Apple Wallet. It's to add specialist apps that solve the problems Apple ignores. Here are the alternatives worth installing in 2025.
best-apple-wallet-alternatives.h2_1: For documents Apple Wallet won't accept
best-apple-wallet-alternatives.p4: Folio stores everything Apple Wallet refuses: passports, residence permits, driver's licenses, insurance policies, vaccination certificates, medical records. Photograph a document and Folio extracts the key data automatically. Set it up once and you get notifications before documents expire. When someone needs to see your insurance details, generate a secure link that expires after they've viewed it.
best-apple-wallet-alternatives.img_alt: Folio app showing BBVA payment card with details, Italian residence permit with extracted data, and trip timeline with Barcelona hotel bookings and flight tickets
best-apple-wallet-alternatives.p5: The real difference shows when you travel. Apple Wallet displays your boarding pass. Folio shows your entire trip in chronological order: the flight, the hotel in Barcelona, the Sagrada Familia tickets, the train to Tarragona, the return journey. Tap any item and the barcode or QR code is ready to scan. Everything works offline because the documents live on your device with end-to-end encryption. For families, shared folders let everyone access the same documents without messaging files back and forth. <0>Available free on iOS and Android.</0>
best-apple-wallet-alternatives.p6: Curve solves a different problem: too many cards. Link all your Visa and Mastercard accounts to Curve, then add just Curve to Apple Wallet. At checkout, one card handles everything. Later, you decide which underlying account actually pays. Made a purchase on the wrong card? "Go Back in Time" moves the charge up to 30 days later. For people who optimize credit card rewards by category, Curve eliminates the fumbling to find the right card before paying.
best-apple-wallet-alternatives.p7: Curve also shows exchange rates before international purchases, unlike Apple Wallet which just charges your bank's rate and reveals the damage on your statement days later. The free tier covers basic card aggregation. Paid tiers add fee-free ATM withdrawals abroad, higher limits, and cashback at selected retailers.
best-apple-wallet-alternatives.h2_3: For trips that involve more than a flight
best-apple-wallet-alternatives.p8: TripIt builds itineraries automatically. Forward any confirmation email to plans@tripit.com and it assembles a master timeline: flights, hotels, restaurant reservations, rental cars, concert tickets. The Pro tier monitors flights for delays and gate changes faster than most airline apps, tracks seat availability for upgrades, and even claims refunds when airlines owe you money. Apple Wallet shows passes in isolation; TripIt shows your entire trip as a story.
best-apple-wallet-alternatives.p9: Pass2U Wallet handles the passes Apple Wallet rejects. That gym membership with a barcode, the loyalty card from a local shop, the ticket that arrived as a PDF instead of a proper .pkpass file: Pass2U converts images into wallet passes. It's not elegant, but it solves the frustration of passes that exist only as screenshots or email attachments.
best-apple-wallet-alternatives.p10: The point isn't to replace Apple Wallet. Tap-to-pay through the Secure Element remains the fastest and most secure way to pay. Express Mode for transit cards and keys works better than any third-party app could. But Apple Wallet is a foundation, not a complete solution. Add Folio for documents and trip organization. Add Curve if you juggle multiple cards. Add TripIt if you travel frequently and want everything in one timeline.
best-apple-wallet-alternatives.p11: The best digital wallet in 2025 isn't a single app. It's a combination that matches how you actually live. Keep Apple Wallet for payments and passes that work natively. Fill the gaps with apps that solve the specific problems Apple hasn't addressed. The result is fewer "where did I save that?" moments and more confidence that everything you need is one tap away.

privacy_page.intro: Folio Technologies Limited ("Folio," "we," "us," or "our") respects your privacy and is committed to protecting your personal data. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you use the Folio Wallet app and related services.
privacy_page.commitment: Our commitment: We operate on a zero-knowledge architecture. Your personal documents are encrypted in your wallet, and we cannot access or view your private information. We will never share your personal data with third parties without your explicit consent.

who_we_are.title: Who we are
who_we_are.p1: Folio Technologies Limited is a company registered in England and Wales (Company Number 07236594). Our registered office is at 88 Baker Street, London W1U 6TQ, United Kingdom. We are the data controller for personal information collected through the Folio app. For privacy questions, contact our data privacy manager at <0>privacy@folio.id</0>.

provide.title: Information you provide
provide.p1: When you create an account, we collect information necessary to verify your identity and provide our services. This may include a selfie for biometric verification. We process this data securely and only with your explicit consent. If you contact our support team, we may temporarily process personal data from documents you need help with. This data is automatically deleted within three days.

auto.title: Information collected automatically
auto.p1: When you use our Services, we automatically collect certain technical and usage information:

list.item1: Device information: device type, operating system, unique device identifiers
list.item2: Connection information: IP address, browser type and version, time zone
list.item3: Usage patterns: anonymized data about how you interact with the app, such as the number of documents stored (but never the content of those documents)

use.title: How we use personal information
use.p1: We use your personal information for the following purposes:

list.item1: To register you as a user and provide our Services
list.item2: To verify your identity and protect against fraud
list.item3: To respond to your support requests and communicate with you
list.item4: To improve, maintain, and secure our app and Services
list.item5: To comply with legal obligations and protect our rights

use.p2: We rely on your consent for processing biometric data such as your selfie. For other processing activities, we rely on our legitimate interests in providing and improving our Services, the performance of our contract with you, or compliance with legal obligations.

security.title: Security and data protection
security.p1: Security is fundamental to our design. We implement robust technical and organizational measures to protect your personal information:

list.item1: Zero-knowledge architecture ensures we cannot access your private data
list.item2: End-to-end encryption protects all data in transit using modern cipher suites
list.item3: Your personal documents are encrypted and stored only in your wallet on your device
list.item4: We store only cryptographic hashes on our servers to detect tampering and protect against fraud
list.item5: We maintain compliance with ISO 27001 and SOC 2 security standards
list.item6: Access to any personal data is strictly limited to authorized personnel on a need-to-know basis

security.p2: Account recovery: During registration, you will be prompted to save a Recovery Code. Due to our zero-knowledge architecture, we cannot help you recover your account or data if you lose this code. Please store it securely.

disclosure.title: Disclosure of personal information
disclosure.p1: We only share your personal information in the following circumstances:

list.item1: With your explicit consent or at your direction
list.item2: With service providers who assist us in operating our Services, under strict contractual obligations
list.item3: To comply with applicable laws, regulations, or legal processes
list.item4: To protect the rights, privacy, safety, or property of Folio, our users, or the public

disclosure.p2: We never sell your personal data. If you choose to share information with third parties through the app, please review their privacy policies before doing so.

transfers.title: International data transfers
transfers.p1: We primarily store personal data in secure locations within the European Economic Area. If we need to transfer data outside the UK or EEA, we ensure appropriate safeguards are in place, such as standard contractual clauses approved by the UK Information Commissioner's Office or European Commission.

retention.title: Data retention
retention.p1: We retain your personal data only for as long as necessary to fulfil the purposes described in this policy. Your documents and information remain in your encrypted wallet until you delete them or your account. Biometric data used for verification is retained for a maximum of three years from your last interaction with the platform, unless longer retention is required by law or to resolve disputes.

rights.title: Your rights
rights.p1: Under applicable data protection laws, including the UK GDPR, you have the following rights:

list.item1: Access: request a copy of the personal data we hold about you
list.item2: Rectification: request correction of inaccurate or incomplete data
list.item3: Erasure: request deletion of your personal data in certain circumstances
list.item4: Restriction: request that we limit how we process your data
list.item5: Portability: receive your data in a structured, commonly used format
list.item6: Objection: object to processing based on legitimate interests
list.item7: Withdraw consent: withdraw consent at any time where we rely on it for processing

rights.p2: To exercise any of these rights, email us at <0>privacy@folio.id</0>. We will respond within one month. We generally do not charge a fee, but we may charge a reasonable fee for manifestly unfounded or excessive requests.

cookies.title: Cookies and similar technologies

cookies.p2: We use the following types of cookies:

list.item2: Analytics cookies: help us understand how visitors interact with our website
list.item3: Preference cookies: remember your settings and preferences
